snippet: The Sunni militants appeared to be falling back on several fronts after two days of American airstrikes in Iraq, Kurdish officials said, as pesh merga troops pushed toward Mosul.
abstract: Sunni militants of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria appear to be falling back on several fronts after two days of American airstrikes in Iraq, allowing Kurdish forces to retake strategic Mosul Dam.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed reported from Alqosh, and Ben Hubbard from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: The Sunni militants appeared to be falling back on several fronts after two days of American airstrikes in Iraq, Kurdish officials said, as pesh merga troops pushed toward Mosul.

headline.main: Kurds Move to Retake Dam as U.S. Bombs Weaken ISIS
headline.print_headline: Kurds Move to Retake Dam as U.S. Bombs Weaken ISIS

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
